properties.Name: AccountingBasis
properties.Description:
The accounting basis in which transactions that change a company's financial statements are recorded in the periods in which the events occur, rather than in the periods in which the company receives or pays cash.

Ex:
CASH BASIS ACCOUNTING
Revenue is recorded only when cash is received and an expense is recorded only when cash is paid. 

Most businesses use the accrual basis, which individuals and professional people sue the cash basis.   The cash basis is not normally suitable when there are significant amounts of inventories, receivables and payables.

ACCRUAL BASIS ACCOUNTING
Accounting basis in which transactions that change a company's financial statements are recorded in the periods in which the events occur, rather than in the periods in which the company receives or pays cash.

Most businesses use the accrual basis, which individuals and professional people use the cash basis.   The cash basis is not normally suitable when there are significant amounts of inventories, receivables and payables.

Columns.Name: AccountingBasisId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Accounting Basis.

Columns.Name: AccountingBasisName
Columns.Description: The name of an Accounting Basis.

Columns.Name: AccountingBasisDescription
Columns.Description: The description of an Accounting Basis.
